definition: close the country to international intercourse
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The close-door policy couldn't steer a country to prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 闭关自守的政策不能引导国家走向繁荣。

sentences.english: A closed economy will not put a country on the way to prosperity .
sentences.chinese: 闭关自守的经济不会使一个国家富起来。

sentences.english: As a consequence, the country declined into poverty and ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 长期闭关自守，把中国搞得贫穷落后，愚昧无知。

sentences.english: We pursued the policy of “self-seclusion” in the past, resulting in “the destitution of the people and exhaustion of the financial resource”.
sentences.chinese: 过去实行“闭关自守”政策，结果搞得“民穷财困”。
一个国家不能闭关自守。

definition: to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
to close a country/to exclude foreign contact/closed country (Qing China, North Korea etc)
closed-door policy
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
prohibition on entering or leaving by sea
semicolonial
natural economy (exchange of goods by bartering not involving money)
uncultured/uncivilized/God-forsaken/ignorant/illiterate
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
treaty port, forced on Qing China by the 19th century Great Powers
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
the Great Powers (history)
having trading relations (of nations or regions)
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
